name: Komaneka at Monkey Forest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've just returned from 10 days in Ubud; 5 days at Komaneka Monkey Forest & 5 days at Komenka Tanggayuda. Both hotels were superb & offered different experiences. Monkey Forest is in the heart of Ubud with the excellent Cafe Wayan literally just outside your doorstep; the hotel offers beauty & serenity amidst the bustle of central Ubud. Lush gardens, gorgeous pool & beautiful villas; everything is aesthetically enchanting. But best of all is the staff who made our stay truly memorable; we met so many lovely people who were incredibly warm, friendly & welcoming.
reviews.title: An beautiful oasis

likes.liked: — Beauty & tranquility & lovely people - fantastic breakfasts

reviews.text: we have just had four nights in this hotel. our experience was fantastic and the staff could not do enough to help us. a couple of examples are when i wanted some stamps for a postcard they just said we will take it to the post office for you,did all our daily excursion bookings for us,booked and delivered us to the local restaurants. in fact everything we asked for was delivered every time. it is a small hotel and quite personal so you tend to be given more service than in a large hotel. the meals were good and infact we had one served pool-side at our villa one night which was brilliant. the pool villa we had was large and roomy with great views of the rice paddies. another great thing about this hotel is you can walk to the monkey forest or the main market in 5 mins and there are lots of local restaurants right out the front of the hotel.
reviews.title: fantastic hotel and location
Perfect hotel in a perfect location
reviews.text: would i stay there again, yes any time.

We stayed at the Komaneka for 4 nights in September 2008 and had an amazing time. First the hotel is right in the thick of downtown Ubud. Walking outside you can pick from tons of restaurants and shops. But as you walk into the Komaneka (which is secluded back off Monkey Forest Road) it seems as though you are walking into the countryside. There is NO noise at all and the gardens and surroundings are luch and inviting. It is the best of both worlds (city variety and country charm). The hotel itself is wonderful. It has the BEST service of any place I have ever stayed. The concierge knows you by name as soon as you check in and helps you with your every need (and greets you every time you come back). The rooms are great with a HUGE sunken tub (for two!), rainforest shower, very comfy beds and nice touches (like turndown service with Komaneka nightgowns). The complimentary afternoon tea is a treat with local sweets next to the infinity pool. The breakfast was great with a choice of eggs/omlette/pancakes/muesli/pastry basket/fresh fruit juices - as much as you'd like. I would highly recommend this place and at $140/night with breakfast it was a steal.
reviews.title: Every time I close my eyes I can se Ubud

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really think that everything I write is poor comparing to how I felt and how I still feel when I think about our stay at Komaneka in Ubud.
reviews.title: Serene Komaneka

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Pleasurably unforgetable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Disappointing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent a long time researching where we wanted to spend our time in Ubud, finally settling on this hotel mainly because of the excellent travel reviews and the location.
reviews.title: A Pampered Experience

likes.liked: — Everything, all the little extra touches including afternoon tea

reviews.text: On arrival we were not at all disappointed as after a long days travel it was a lovely touch to be offered a fresh juice and sented towel to wipe our faces/ hands.
reviews.title: Sheer luxury. Prepare to be pampered.

likes.disliked: — Spa a bit pricey, but plenty of good ones outside.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds certainly were immacuately lanscaped and cared for and when we entered our private villa we were gobsmacked at how beautiful and serene our surroundings were.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel & Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Bali for two weeks in June and stayed in 3 different areas. The first please we stayed was at the Komaneka for 5 nights and didn’t want to leave. We arrived into Denpasar around 7pm and arrived at the Komaneka around 8.30pm. We were impressed as soon as we got off the coach. The entrance to the lobby was stunning very open and welcoming feeling. The staff were very friendly and efficient. We were offered a seat a wet towel and a welcome drink which was very refreshing. After doing the paper work for checking in we were escorted to our room and the layout of the resort was explained to us. The grounds were immaculate not a leaf out of place. We were shown to our room which is very private almost like a villa, it was stunning. The love heart flower arrangement on the bed was so fantastic that we didn’t want to remove it. We were than shown the room layout where the light switches were, the complimentary water, biscuits and fruit. The room had a great bath (including bubble bath) which after a long flight we took advantage of. It would have been around 9.30 10pm and we were still able to order room service and the food not to badly priced. We had a few massages as well and by staying 5 nights we actually had a complimentary 60 minute massage per person heaven. The location is great walking distance the Monkey forest as well as restaurants right outside our door. The only thing that was average was the breakfast but with restaurants almost open 24 hours who is to complain. Nothing could be faulted at the wonderful place. Staff were fantastic including the garden staff who were quiet willing to take our bags from us and help us to our rooms. Will definitely be going back.
reviews.title: absolutely heaven

likes.disliked: — BREAKFAST, AND IT WASN'T THAT BAD

reviews.text: We stayed at the Komaneka for 4 days at the beginning of July. We have 2 children (15 and 8) so we booked a standard room for them and a luxurious pool villa for us (Its our money after all!).
reviews.title: Rustic luxury at Komaneka

reviews.text: The hotel organised transfers for us from Denpasar. The young driver was fabulous. Bintang and cold towels arranged to de-stress us from the money grabbers at the airport (that's just the immigration guys). The drive to Ubud is pretty short but transport in Bali is very slow so be prepared for a longer than anticipated journey....everywhere.
reviews.title: Blissful spa

likes.liked: — peace and quiet and central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel reception is beautiful with a water theme. We were given drinks on arrival by young, attentive staff. First impressions were excellent. It was dark when we arrived but the beautiful hotel grounds were apparent. The kids room opened on to a rice paddy and our pool villa opened on to a gorge with coconut palms and banana trees. The bathroom of our villa was ostensibly open air and had a pond surrounding our bath inhabited by Koi and a couple of toads. Quite fabulous! Add to this the grass roof of the villa and it was a unique feeling. To my mind there is no point traveling half way round the world to stay in a corporate, western hotel chain room. The house geckos completed the picture.
reviews.title: An Oasis in Ubud

likes.liked: — It's a peaceful retreat with lots of activity directly outside
likes.disliked: — Sometimes a bit of nature comes into your room - but I think that's unavoidable in Ubud

reviews.text: Ubud is a working, vibrant town, so be prepared that no matter where you are there is noise. Cockerels, mopeds, cars, farm workers etc. A lie in in Ubud may not be possible if you are a light sleeper like me. Exit from the comparative tranquility of Komaneka and you hit the maelstrom of Jalang monkey forest! At one end the monkeys and the other the market. In between there are wonderful shops and a thousand taxi drivers looking to take you around Bali. The market is an assault on your senses and not to be missed, and a word of warning, never come between a monkey and its banana! They do bite and scratch and steal.
reviews.title: Just perfect

aka: Komaneka At Monkey Forest Hotel Ubud
description: The newest Komaneka in Ubud is designed as a sophisticated and contemporary lifestyle destination. It's 10 elegant villas, each with its 12 meter long private pool, and 34 spacious suites are completed with a half-olympic sized main pool, an Indonesian fine dining restaurant, luxurious spa-villa, and wedding chapel. Located at Jalan Bisma, in the center of Ubud, overlooking the the hills and Campuhan River.
